Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

Author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that explores the issues of marriage, morality, and misunderstandings.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream set in the 1920s.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about adolescent alienation and loss of innocence.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
description: An epic sea story of Captain Ahab’s voyage in pursuit of the white whale.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A strong narrative of an orphan girl’s growth and moral development.

Title: Animal Farm
Author: George Orwell
description: A political allegory about a group of animals rebelling against their human farmer.

Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott
description: A coming-of-age story about the four March sisters.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel about a genetically engineered society.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological study of guilt and redemption.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
description: A gothic tale of love and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates a monster, with tragic consequences.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd's journey to discover his personal legend.

Title: Great Expectations
Author: Charles Dickens
description: The growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
description: A man remains young while his portrait ages.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
description: A horror classic introducing the character of Count Dracula.

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Author: Charles Dickens
description: A historical novel set during the French Revolution.

Title: Les Misérables
Author: Victor Hugo
description: An epic tale of justice, love, and redemption.

Title: Don Quixote
Author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The adventures of a deluded knight and his loyal squire.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A gripping tale of betrayal and revenge.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian future where books are outlawed.

Title: The Stranger
Author: Albert Camus
description: A philosophical novel about absurdism and detachment.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic story of survival and fatherly love.
